title: Eligibility
introduction: Probate gives you the legal right to deal with a person’s property, money and possessions (their ‘estate’) after they’ve died.
paragraph1: You will need to submit an application and send your documents to the probate registry. We’ll tell you exactly what you need to send once you have completed your application.
paragraph2: Before you start your application, you will need:
listItem1: the details of the person who died
listItem2: the original will, if the person who died left one, and any codicils
listItem3: the name, email address and mobile phone number for each person applying for probate
listItem4: the values of the estate for Inheritance Tax (IHT) â€“ you can estimate these using HMRC’s
listItem5: a debit or credit card, if you need to pay a fee
listItem6: If the person who died did not leave a will, you must also check if you are the most entitled person to apply (opens in a new tab) before you start.
linkText3: online IHT checker (opens in a new tab)
applicationStartedHeader: Have you already started an application?
